Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat grazing to right (part of back, rump and hind legs, muzzle and front feet missing); at right, trace of undetermined motif, probably horn of antithetic goat; pendant lozenge, rising roundel and parts of maeander squares as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0156) (phase 2)
